Sec. 90-52. - Deposit of waste in unsanitary manner. It shall be unlawful for any person to place, deposit, or permit to be deposited in any unsanitary manner upon public or private property within the county, or in any area under the jurisdiction of the authority, any human or animal excrement, garbage, or other objectionable waste. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-53. - Discharge of polluted water. It shall be unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the county, or in any area under the jurisdiction of the authority, any sanitary sewage, industrial wastes, or other polluted waters, except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of this article. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-54. - Use of private wastewater disposal. Where a public sanitary sewer is not available, the building sewer shall be connected to a private wastewater disposal system complying with the provisions of the Butts County Health Department and the Georgia Department of Natural Resources. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-55. - Destruction or tampering with sewer system. (a) Violations and penalties. Any person, consumer, firm or corporation that without the authorization of the authority: (1) Connects onto a sewer line of the authority; (2) Refuses to connect onto a sewer line of the Authority when required according to section 90-58 of this division; (3) Disconnects a sewer line from a sewer line of the authority; or (4) Maliciously, willfully or negligently breaks, damages, destroys, uncovers, defaces, or tampers with any structure, appurtenance or equipment which is a part of the sewer system of the authority; shall become liable to the authority for any loss, damage or expense incurred by the authority, including, but not limited to, all costs of labor, material expenses, loss of income, attorneys' fees, expert witness fees, court costs and litigation costs, by reason of such violation. Said person, consumer, firm, or corporation shall also be subject to a minimum fine of $250.00, to a maximum fine of $1,000.00 plus damages and/or imprisonment in the county jail for a minimum of 30 days to a maximum of 60 days. (b) Court of jurisdiction. The Magistrate Court of Butts County, Georgia, shall have jurisdiction to hear, try, and dispose of citations that are issued for said violations. (c) Citations. All consumers, person, firms, or corporations who are charged with having violated this division shall be issued a citation by the Butts County Code Enforcement Officer, the Butts County Sheriff's Department, or a representative of the authority. Said citation shall require the appearance of the violator in the Magistrate Court of Butts County, Georgia to any said charges. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-56. - Private and decentralized sewer systems. Except as to those systems in operation as of December 15, 2005, no person or entity shall construct, use or operate any private or decentralized sewer system within the unincorporated areas of Butts County, Georgia. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-57. - Dedication of private or decentralized sewer systems. The Butts County, et al. Water and Sewer Authority shall have the authority to accept or decline the dedication of any private or decentralized sewer system, provided, however, that there shall be no dedication to, nor acceptance by Butts County, Georgia, or the Butts County, et al. Water and Sewer Authority of any private or decentralized sewer system utilizing subsurface or underground disposal of wastewater (i.e., septic tanks, field lines) at a rate of 149,999 gallons per day or less. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Sec. 90-58. - Mandatory connection to sewer system. (a) Mandatory connection for new construction. All new construction requiring a building permit that includes plumbing facilities will be required to connect to the authority's sewer system under the following conditions: (1) Where there is an authority-owned gravity sewer main within a distance of 300 feet to the closest property line, or where such main will be in place within 90 days of issuance of said building permit; and (2) Where sewer service capacity is currently available according to the policies of the authority, or where such service capacity will be available within 90 days of issuance of said building permit. (b) Mandatory connection for existing structures. Existing structures with plumbing facilities will be required to connect to the authority's sewer system under the following conditions: (1) Where there is an authority-owned gravity sewer main within a distance of 300 feet to the closest property line and where sewer service capacity is currently available according to the policies of the authority; and (2) Where any of the following conditions are present: a. The existing on-site wastewater system has failed, or is damaged, and requires a permit from the Butts County Health Department to be repaired; or b. As directed by the Butts County Health Department; or c. When an existing structure will be occupied by a business that obtains a new business license; or d. As ordered by any public court of proper jurisdiction. (Ord. of 11-17-2014, § 1(Exh. A)) Secs. 90-59—90-65. - Reserved. DIVISION 3. - ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT
Sec. 90-66. - Access powers. (a) Access to properties. Duly authorized employees of the county and authority shall be permitted to enter all properties for the purposes of inspection, observation, measurement, sampling, and testing pertinent to discharge to the public sewer systems in accordance with the provisions of this article. (b) Access to Information Concerning Industrial Processes. Duly authorized employees of the county and authority are empowered to obtain information concerning industrial processes which have a direct bearing on the kind and source of discharge to the wastewater collection system. (c) Access to easements. Duly authorized employees of the county and authority shall be permitted to enter all private properties through which the authority holds a duly executed easement for the purposes of, but not limited to, inspection, observation, measurement, sampling, repairing and maintenance of any portion of the wastewater facilities lying within such easement. Sec. 90-67. - Suspension of service. (a) Application of security deposit. When sewer service is discontinued either by the customer or the authority, the authority shall apply the security deposit held to the balance of the sewer bill owed by the customer and refund the difference, if any exists, to the customer. (b) Termination without notice. The authority reserves the right to terminate its service without notice for the following reasons: (1) To prevent fraud or abuse. (2) The customer's willful or negligent disregard of the terms of this article and any amendments thereto or any of the rules of the authority. (3) Emergency repairs. (4) Insufficiency of water and sewer supply due to circumstances beyond the authority's control. (5) Insufficiency of sewage treatment system. (6) Legal processes. (7) Direction of public authorities. (8) Strike, riot, fire, flood, unavoidable accident, actions of others, or acts of God. (c) Termination of service for other reasons. The authority reserves the right to terminate the services granted by the authority for any other reason other than those stated above by giving the customer ten days written notice of the date of termination, and further providing the customer with a right to hearing prior to termination of the service. Sec. 90-68. - Fees ands rates. (a) Authority to set. The authority is empowered to set the sewer rates and service connection fees and capital recovery fees, if applicable. The authority reserves the right to change the rates and fees from time to time and to set and collect additional fees or surcharges when necessary. A sewer user fee is charged to the customer on a monthly basis for sewage processed by the authority. The authority will charge a minimum monthly fee to all sewer users. (b) Review of rates; Adjustments. The rate schedule is set forth in Appendix B. The rate schedule may be modified from time to time. However, rates will not increase without thirty (30) days notice to the consumer. Notice will be sufficiently given to the consumer by a publication of the rate changes in at least two (2) times in consecutive weeks on the official newspaper of Butts County prior to the increase. (c) Service deposit. The authority is authorized to establish deposit fees to be paid for sewer service and to collect such fees upon application for service and at such other times as the authority may determine to be necessary. Notice will be sufficiently given to the consumer by a publication of deposit fee changes at least two (2) times in consecutive weeks in the official newspaper of Butts County prior to the increase. (d) Right of authority to refuse service to those not using public water. Except as otherwise negotiated and approved, the authority reserves the right to refuse sewer service to any customer not using the public water system. Secs. 90-69—90-75. - Reserved. DIVISION 4. - CAPITAL RECOVERY FEES
Sec. 90-76. - Capital recovery fee and connection fee required. (a) Capital recovery fee required. Any person or corporation who ties onto the sewer system shall pay a Capital Recovery Fee in the manner and amount established by this ordinance. In all cases, the Capital Recovery Fee must be paid prior to authorization of connection to the sewer system in the form of an approved Tap Agreement. (b) Connection fee required. The total for connection to the sewer system shall be the sum of the Capital Recovery Fee, plus the connection fee, which is set by the authority's board of directors to cover the cost of materials, labor and related costs of the sewer tap. Sec. 90-77. - Computation of capital recovery fees. The capital recovery fee assessment shall be in accordance with the fee schedule shown in Appendix A or as otherwise established pursuant to applicable procedures of this ordinance. Any Capital Recovery Fee imposed shall not exceed a project's proportionate share of the cost of system improvements, shall be calculated on the basis of the establishment of service areas, and shall be calculated on the basis of levels of service for public facilities that are the same for existing development as for new growth and development.
